DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate telephone-delivered cognitive-behavioral psychotherapy intervention design primary care treatment combat-exposed service member PTSD . The investigator assess Posttraumatic Stress Disorder ( PTSD ) symptom , mental health-related occupational functioning , symptom depression , anxiety , somatization .
DOC.brief_title: Delivery Self Training Education Stressful Situations-Telephone Version
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize controlled trial compare DESTRESS-T Optimized Usual Care ( OUC ) . Optimized Usual Care usual primary care PTSD treatment , plus telephone care management program include : four outreach call , feedback treat primary care provider ( PCP ) , care coordination .
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 year DSMIV diagnosis PTSD ( derive CAPS ) due combat OIF/OEF deployment Active duty personnel Active suicidal violent ideation within past two month assess MINI supplementary form develop project team ( see Appendices ) Current participation active psychotherapy ( e.g. , psychoanalysis , CBT ) mood , anxiety substance use disorder ( determined via service member self report and/or check medical record ) Recurrent PTSD treatment failure psychotherapy , determine via consensus study team member ( Dr. Charles Engel , Dr. Brett Litz , Dr. Kristie Gore ) Current alcohol dependence , assess MINI Acute psychosis , psychotic episode , psychotic disorder diagnosis within past year , assess MINI Currently antipsychotic moodstabilizing agent bipolar disorder disorder psychotic feature , determine medical record and/or self report Unstable administration schedule dose antidepressant , anxiolytic , sedativehypnotic ( i.e. , exclude relate medication change month prior randomization ) , determine medical record service member self report Acute unstable physical illness base judgment patient 's primary care clinician study team .
